alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 06 at 3:44AM PST until February 08 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING ABOVE 3500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 3500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 14 inches are possible above 3500 feet, with lesser amounts below. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Washington Cascades. * WHEN...From late tonight through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow will be along the crest of the southern Washington Cascades, especially north of Snoqualmie Pass. Significant impacts are possible over Snoqualmie Pass.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
